poem:
### In Kiev's Chill  

In Kiev's chill, the leaves  
whisper stories of unrest.  
Voices in corridors echo  
with the promise of change.  
The air, thick with a pause  
before the storm, anticipates  
men with foreign tongues  
to speak an end.

Yet the ground remains  
indifferent, wearing frost  
as war's familiar coat.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Will the Ukraine missile crisis change the course of the war? In Kyiv, as autumn turns fast turns to winter, Ukrainians in the government describe a vacuum before the arrival of Donald Trump in the White House on 20 January that will be filled by more war as both sides jockey for advantage. “Trump has said he wants to end the war within 24 hours. Nobody is more interested in this topic than Ukraine,” a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
